com.spazedog.lib.rootfw3.extenders

Class FilesystemExtender.Device

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.spazedog.lib.rootfw3.extenders.FilesystemExtender.Device
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ExtenderGroup
    Enclosing class:
    FilesystemExtender

    public static class FilesystemExtender.Device
extends java.lang.Object
implements ExtenderGroup
    This class is used to handle devices and mount points. It can be used to get data about a device like size, mount point, file system type etc. It can also be used to move a device mount point, remount a device, unmount, mount etc.
    Note that this implements the ExtenderGroup interface, which means that it does not allow anything outside RootFW to create an instance of it. Use RootFW.filesystem(String) to retrieve an instance.

      • addMount

        public java.lang.Boolean addMount(java.lang.String[] options)
        This is a short method for adding additional options to a mount location or device. For an example, parsing remount instructions.
        Parameters:
        options - A string array containing all of the mount options to parse
        Returns:
        True on success, False otherwise
        See Also:
        addMount(String, String, String[])

        type - The file system type to mount a device as
        Returns:
        True on success, False otherwise
        See Also:
        addMount(String, String, String[])

      • addMount

        public java.lang.Boolean addMount(java.lang.String location,
                         java.lang.String type,
                         java.lang.String[] options)
        This is used for attaching a device or folder to a location, or to change any mount options on a current mounted file system.
        Note that if the device parsed to the constructor #Device(ShellExtender, String) or via RootFW.filesystem(String) is a folder, this method will use the --bind option to attach it to the location. Also note that when attaching folders to a location, the type and options arguments will not be used and should just be parsed as NULL.
        Parameters:
        location - The location where the device or folder should be attached to
        type - The file system type to mount a device as
        options - A string array containing all of the mount options to parse
        Returns:
        True on success, False otherwise

      • removeMount

        public java.lang.Boolean removeMount()
        This method is used to remove an attachment of a device or folder (unmount).
        Returns:
        True on success, False otherwise

      • moveMount

        public java.lang.Boolean moveMount(java.lang.String destination)
        This method is used to move a mount location to another location.
        Returns:
        True on success, False otherwise

      • statMount

        public FilesystemExtender.MountStat statMount()
        This is the same as FilesystemExtender#getMountList(), only this method will just return the mount information for this specific device or mount location.
        Returns:
        A single FilesystemExtender.MountStat object

      • statFstab

        public FilesystemExtender.MountStat statFstab()
        This is the same as FilesystemExtender#getFstabList(), only this method will just return the mount information for this specific device or mount location.
        Returns:
        A single FilesystemExtender.MountStat object

      • statDisk

        public FilesystemExtender.DiskStat statDisk()
        Like with statMount(), this will also return information like device path and mount location. However, it will not return information like file system type or mount options, but instead information about the disk size, remaining bytes, used bytes and usage percentage.
        Returns:
        A single FilesystemExtender.DiskStat object

      • isMounted

        public java.lang.Boolean isMounted()
        This is used to check whether the current device or folder is attached to a location (Mounted).
        Returns:
        True if mounted, False otherwise

      • hasOption

        public java.lang.Boolean hasOption(java.lang.String option)
        This is used to check if a mounted file system was mounted with a specific mount option. Note that options like mode=xxxx can also be checked by just parsing mode as the argument.
        Parameters:
        option - The name of the option to find
        Returns:
        True if the options was used to attach the device, False otherwise

      • getOption

        public java.lang.String getOption(java.lang.String option)
        This can be used to get the value of a specific mount option that was used to attach the file system. Note that options like noexec, nosuid and nodev does not have any values and will return NULL. This method is used to get values from options like gid=xxxx, mode=xxxx and size=xxxx where xxxx is the value.
        Parameters:
        option - The name of the option to find
        Returns:
        True if the options was used to attach the device, False otherwise

      • fsType

        public java.lang.String fsType()
        See Also:
        fsType(Boolean)

      • fsType

        public java.lang.String fsType(java.lang.Boolean realType)
        This can be used to get the real file system type of a device. Although methods like statMount() can also return the file system type, it can only return the name of the file system driver being used. In most cases this will be enough, as a specific driver often is used on a specific type. However, file system drivers like EXT4 can also be, and is often, used on EXT2 and EXT3 file systems.
        Note however that this method requires a busybox version that supports blkid with type information. As a fail-safe, the method will get the type from the mount information if a supported blkid is not available. In this case however, it will only work on a mounted file systems.
        Parameters:
        realType - If True, it will not use the mount information when a supported blkid is not available
        Returns:
        The device file system type
